item.title: Associate hostname with IP address
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
You can do that in the /etc/hosts file:

127.0.0.1       localhost
192.168.1.10    foo.mydomain.org       foo
192.168.1.13    bar.mydomain.org       bar
146.82.138.7    master.debian.org      master
209.237.226.90  www.opensource.org

So, from the command line, you can do:

ping foo.mydomain.org

Or:

ssh user@foo

Source: http://linux.die.net/man/5/hosts

item.title: Size occupied on the server
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
The following command, executed as root:

du -h --max-depth 1 /

will show used space per directory, looking at "/"

item.title: Introduction to patching in Python
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description: @patch('time.sleep') def test_do_something(mock_sleep): mock_sleep.return_value = True do_something() test_do_something() ok from mock import patch import time def do_something(): if time.sleep(100): print 'ok' else: print 'ko' @patch('time.sleep') def test_do_something(mock_sleep): mock_sleep.return_value = True do_something() @patch('time.sleep') def test_do_something(mock_sleep): mock_sleep.return_value = False do_something() test_do_something() ko

item.title: Port in use
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
To find which application is using a specific port, do:

lsof -i <port-number>

Or list ports with associated processes in use:

netstat -putln

item.title: Logs
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
The configuration and especially right permissions will be done in /etc/rsyslog.conf

Bitmask is going to be used so use this doc http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/unix-linux-bsd-chmod-numeric-permissions-notation-command/

It will be taken into account for the new log files only when we reload rsylog with this commend:

/etc/init.d/rsyslog reload

The old files are still on the old configuration. So, you need to change the right access directly for them with chown and chmod.

Example for vagrant user:

root@openerp-development:/var/log/openerp# chown vagrant:vagrant /var/log/openerp/ -R
root@openerp-development:/var/log/openerp# chmod a+r /var/log/openerp/ -R

Source: http://www.rsyslog.com/

item.title: Screen monitoring
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
You can use this chrome plugin if you want to monitor different screen with a slideshow: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/tabcarousel/ddldimidiliclngjipajmjjiakhbcohn?hl=en

item.title: Agile testing
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
The best book I ever read about testing and best practices in an Agile project is: Agile Testing: A Practical Guide for Testers and Agile Teams (Addison-Wesley Signature)

The main idea of Agility is constantly giving and receiving feedback in order to keep improving the process and the output of the project.
